intro: Psychotria lanata, commonly known as the woolly psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It often grows as an understory plant in rainforests, contributing to the complex biodiversity of these ecosystems. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
